intro: Pterinodes orientalis, commonly known as the oriental pterinodes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface. Pterinodes orientalis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
